Peter, I think re-querying the CPPN over time is a great idea.  We've
talke=
d about it in our research group but we don't have any ongoing
projects wit=
h it, and I don't know of any.  The only downside is that
all that querying=
 will get expensive.  However, it's very interesting
because it means that =
the learning rules themselves become distributed
in a pattern, and are "mad=
e up" by HyperNEAT rather than being
preselected by the experimenter.

The =
CPPN might also be able to output Hebbian parameters; although
that is less=
 groundbreaking, though it might work well.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.c=

wrote:
>
> Hi all, 
> 
> It i=
s an interesting idea to see what if the phenotypes produced by the 
> CPPN=
s change over their lifetime. There are two approaches to this: the 
> CPPN=
 can output hebbian learning parameters to the connections or the 
> CPPN c=
an be re-queried every time step, so the connections will be 
> basically d=
ifferent every time, depending on the environment, which 
> will be input t=
o the CPPN. 
> Is there any ongoing research into this? 
> 
> Peter
